snippet.textDisplay: For longer bearded men, make the mask 10" tall. This design easily catches the shorter styles of beards.  And it fits big noses or prominent chins. As shown the mask ends up 8 inches wide. But all men need the mask to be 1 - 2 inches wider.  So measure your guy before cutting.
snippet.textOriginal: For longer bearded men, make the mask 10" tall. This design easily catches the shorter styles of beards.  And it fits big noses or prominent chins. As shown the mask ends up 8 inches wide. But all men need the mask to be 1 - 2 inches wider.  So measure your guy before cutting.

snippet.textDisplay: Love this pattern!  My sewing machine is 45 years old and I was having problems going through all the pleats.  Do you need to have two pieces of the inside material?  Could you not just cut two pieces 5-1/2 by 8 and sew them together leaving the gap for the filter?  By top stitching, the chance of the seam allowance fraying with washing is eliminated.
snippet.textOriginal: Love this pattern!  My sewing machine is 45 years old and I was having problems going through all the pleats.  Do you need to have two pieces of the inside material?  Could you not just cut two pieces 5-1/2 by 8 and sew them together leaving the gap for the filter?  By top stitching, the chance of the seam allowance fraying with washing is eliminated.

snippet.textDisplay:
I want to share this with you, if you don't mind.

The Bible says in Ephesians 2:8-9 KJV For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God: not of works, lest any man should boast.
I hope you already know God for yourself, but if you don't know Him you can know Him today.
Jesus suffered, bled and died to pay for your sins and mine, out of love for us!
Salvation is in faith, but one must first realize that they are a lost sinner and will die and burn in hell for eternity without Christ, once we see ourselves, all one needs to do is repent of their sins, and put their faith in God: believing with all their heart that He will forgive every sin. And ask Him to save their soul from hell with all faith and all sincerity! Believe in God and He will save you today.
If you have never gone to God and repented of your sins and put your faith in Him, now is the time my friend.

snippet.textDisplay: I am making these as well!  I put a small casing at the top of the mask on the inside.  That way I can easily change out the wire if needed.  I am using twist ties from bread bags.

snippet.textDisplay: Great design!!!  A helpful tip, dip the end of the cording in clear fingernail polish to stop fraying.

snippet.textDisplay: Thank you for this great tutorial! I have a possible substitution for wire - another site suggested taking a long pipe cleaner and folding 3 x, and wrapping the ends with a small piece of duct tape.  I may do this if I can not get wire.

snippet.textDisplay:
Will this style fit over an N95 mask? I don't have one, so can't experiment myself.

I know it's designed for a filter insert, but they are so fast to make, it would be great if they did. I'd like to surprise some nursing friends and essential worker friends before making a bunch. This way they can cover their N95, and when they have no more N95s, they can insert a filter; all with the same mask. Thank you for this wonderful tutorial! :)

snippet.textDisplay: I'm a nurse; this is by far the easiest-looking mask to make, and I love how it contours on the sides and goes way down the neck! I'm planning to make boatloads of these with my girls. Thank you!!

snippet.textDisplay: I work in a food plant and have been struggling how to sort out the mask issue for my team mates.  This one with 54" shoelaces resolved the dilemma!  Possible to make quickly and does seal around the sides, which doesn't necessary happen with other styles.  Do suggest checking the size for fit  if making for personal use.  I found 12" x 8" fit better for me. Can't thank you enough for this great tutorial.  Thank you for being on the front lines also.  God Bless!!!
snippet.textOriginal: I work in a food plant and have been struggling how to sort out the mask issue for my team mates.  This one with 54" shoelaces resolved the dilemma! snippet.textDisplay:
For filters you can also use the 3M Filtrete 1500 MPR Ultra Allergen filter or any of the filters that say they block viruses. You can get them at Walmart, Lowe's, hardware stores, but my local Kroger had a pretty big one for $20.
https://www.lowes.com/pd/Filtrete-1500-MPR-Ultra-Allergen-Common-14-in-x-30-in-x-1-in-Actual-13-7-in-x-29-7-in-x-0-7812-in-Electrostatic-Pleated-Air-Filter/3514390
snippet.textOriginal:
For filters you can also use the 3M Filtrete 1500 MPR Ultra Allergen filter or any of the filters that say they block viruses. You can get them at Walmart, Lowe's, hardware stores, but my local Kroger had a pretty big one for $20.

snippet.textDisplay: Just an idea but if you use clothesline rope you might want to strip the core out of the rope. Usually clothesline rope has like this packing in the middle. Just pull it out before you knot it. It won't hurt the integrity of the rope and it will make it softer and more lightweight. All us bubble performers do that to make our bubble wands.  I've had ropes last for years with the core removed. Much easier to tie too. Aluminum wire also doesn't rust I made mine out of 18 gauge aluminum wire I got at the farm implement store
snippet.textOriginal: Just an idea but if you use clothesline rope you might want to strip the core out of the rope. Usually clothesline rope has like this packing in the middle. Just pull it out before you knot it. It won't hurt the integrity of the rope and it will make it softer and more lightweight. All us bubble performers do that to make our bubble wands.  I've had ropes last for years with the core removed. Much easier to tie too. Aluminum wire also doesn't rust I made mine out of 18 gauge aluminum wire I got at the farm implement store

snippet.textDisplay: I've watched a few mask tutorials but I really like the design of this one. Thank you for your thoughtful and hard work!

snippet.textDisplay: I was inspired to try my hand at making masks to give away and made one tonight after someone shared this video with me. It was very easy to make. The mask fits great and the ties stay put. For someone like me who has very little experience with my 20 year old sewing machine and no fancy sewing supplies, this was totally easy. I had a whole bunch of unused cloth napkins from a neighbor, long shoelaces,  and lots of cotton baby cloths. I used a school ruler, charcoal drawing pencil and kitchen shears. Thank you so much for this video. It was easy to follow because you explained each step very clearly and slowly. I’m going to make as many as I can and give them away to neighbors who are asking for them. Stay safe everyone!
snippet.textOriginal: I was inspired to try my hand at making masks to give away and made one tonight after someone shared this video with me. It was very easy to make. The mask fits great and the ties stay put. For someone like me who has very little experience with my 20 year old sewing machine and no fancy sewing supplies, this was totally easy. I had a whole bunch of unused cloth napkins from a neighbor, long shoelaces,  and lots of cotton baby cloths. I used a school ruler, charcoal drawing pencil and kitchen shears. Thank you so much for this video. It was easy to follow because you explained each step very clearly and slowly. I’m going to make as many as I can and give them away to neighbors who are asking for them. Stay safe everyone!

snippet.textDisplay:
Just made my first, and maybe I used the wrong material, but my mask is so stiff it doesn't conform to the face on the sides, once secured. There's about 1.5" too much fabric I can pinch in at the sides. I used woven quilting cotton.
Considering cutting back the doubled-over inner piece to single-thickness with finished inner edge, to debulk the folded sides. Then could maybe throw in a pleat, as sides would then be 4 layers rather than 6 throughout most of the mask.
snippet.textOriginal:
Just made my first, and maybe I used the wrong material, but my mask is so stiff it doesn't conform to the face on the sides, once secured. There's about 1.5" too much fabric I can pinch in at the sides. I used woven quilting cotton.
Considering cutting back the doubled-over inner piece to single-thickness with finished inner edge, to debulk the folded sides. Then could maybe throw in a pleat, as sides would then be 4 layers rather than 6 throughout most of the mask.

snippet.textDisplay: We appreciate all that you and your coworkers are doing on the front line. I live in Hawaii and work as a Social Worker for a local Hospice Agency and was able to quickly sew masks for the nurses in my company. In addition I was able to send out a request on nextdoor.com and was able to get 80 people to join me. We hope that every mask we give will help to keep the wearers safe. Take Care of yourself and family and Thank you for this tutorial, it seems much easier than the ones I was making.
snippet.textOriginal: We appreciate all that you and your coworkers are doing on the front line.  I live in Hawaii and work as a Social Worker for a local Hospice Agency and was able to quickly sew masks for the nurses in my company.  In addition I was able to send out a request on nextdoor.com and was able to get 80 people to join me.  We hope that every mask we give will help to keep the wearers safe.  Take Care of yourself and family and Thank you for this tutorial, it seems much easier than the ones I was making.

snippet.textDisplay: Another way to put that wire in is to zigzag stitch over it in the seam allowance. It stays very secure. If you do with the insert part down and the wrong side of the outside up it has several layers of fabric as cushion. Still nice to topstitch in.
snippet.textOriginal: Another way to put that wire in is to zigzag stitch over it in the seam allowance. It stays very secure. If you do with the insert part down and the wrong side of the outside up it has several layers of fabric as cushion. Still nice to topstitch in.

snippet.textDisplay:
The time left is very limited. The rapture is soon to happen. Jesus Christ is coming back for His bride. Those left behind will experience the Great Tribulation. I've seen Jesus Christ and He's real. If you seek Him you will find Him. He sounds like a Mighty Lion surrounded by many waterfalls.

It's not God's will that anyone perish but all repent to receive eternal life. I don't want anyone to be disappointed for all eternity, or say they never knew Jesus Christ is coming. Now you know. It's your choice to accept or reject Him. God will not force His will on anyone.

If you're willing, seek Him where you stand. God is omnipresent. We don't need to be at church. God is not limited to a building. If you seek The Lord, He will answer you at His time. He sounds like a Mighty Lion surrounded by many waterfalls.

Those who refuse to seek Jesus Christ will be left behind. They will have to suffer if they wish to enter into the kingdom. It's a choice, there are consequences for poor choices.

If you're willing, now is the time to repent and prepare for the return of the King. He is coming. Everything written in the book of revelation will be fulfilled. We are the last generation.

snippet.textDisplay: Thank you so much for the mask tutorial! I have made 5 of them in one day. My only question is, they don't fit "comfortably" on my face? I have tried a few different modifications, but it seems like they all are too close to my eyes or I have to pull it down and touch it a lot to keep it away from my eyes. Am I making a mistake somewhere? I don't have the gardening wire, but have tried to use a pipe cleaner (suggested from another website). Is the wire / lack of correct wire the issue?
snippet.textOriginal: Thank you so much for the mask tutorial! I have made 5 of them in one day. My only question is, they don't fit "comfortably" on my face? I have tried a few different modifications, but it seems like they all are too close to my eyes or I have to pull it down and touch it a lot to keep it away from my eyes. Am I making a mistake somewhere? I don't have the gardening wire, but have tried to use a pipe cleaner (suggested from another website). Is the wire / lack of correct wire the issue?

snippet.textDisplay:
I agree that this style is by far the best style out of the various styles I've made so far, and the most liked from what I've been told by the wearers. I make my own ties from 1/2 bias tape and cut and sew fabric strips together as if I was making my own bias tape. Long shoe strings will work, too. if you go to the facebook page for The Hillery Company, you can request the perfect metal strips from them for the nose fitting (ask for just the amount you will use to make donated masks to those front line warriors, or for your own family). there is a form on their fb page to fill out. They cannot take phone calls. this is from their facebook page:


https://www.facebook.com/Hillerycompany
UPDATE: We are still making the metal piece for face masks as fast as we can. Please fill out the form in the following link and we will get them out to you. Please only request what you need at this time. Also please donate to our Go Fund Me to help cover the shipping. Thank you and stay safe.
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc5_DGmpIWOncrE8ualX_Kp6MHqXGuLW6hLQ3QxvYuGf8NEQg/viewform?usp=sf_link
snippet.textOriginal:
I agree that this style is by far the best style out of the various styles I've made so far, and the most liked from what I've been told by the wearers.  I make my own ties from 1/2 bias tape and cut and sew fabric strips together as if I was making my own bias tape. Long shoe strings will work, too.   if you go to the facebook page for The Hillery Company, you can request the perfect metal strips from them  for the nose fitting (ask for just the amount you will use to make donated masks to those front line warriors, or for your own family).  there is a form on their fb page to fill out.  They cannot take phone calls.   this is from their facebook page: 


https://www.facebook.com/Hillerycompany
 UPDATE:  We are still making the metal piece for face masks as fast as we can.  Please fill out the form in the following link and we will get them out to you. Please only request what you need at this time.  Also please donate to our Go Fund Me to help cover the shipping.  Thank you and stay safe.  
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc5_DGmpIWOncrE8ualX_Kp6MHqXGuLW6hLQ3QxvYuGf8NEQg/viewform?usp=sf_link

snippet.textDisplay: Thank you for these directions.  We had some of the "special" masks; however, the elastic doesn't fit everyone's facial proportions.  This was much easier to sew (terrific instructions!). Our favorite part is the tie going around the neck, tying once.  I was told it looked more like a surgeon's mask.  Congrats!  Remove the inner liner, and wash for reuse.
snippet.textOriginal: Thank you for these directions.  We had some of the "special" masks; however, the elastic doesn't fit everyone's facial proportions.  This was much easier to sew (terrific instructions!). Our favorite part is the tie going around the neck, tying once.  I was told it looked more like a surgeon's mask.  Congrats!  Remove the inner liner, and wash for reuse.

snippet.textDisplay: Wish I had a sewing machine to do this. I’m going to try tomorrow and sew by hand!
snippet.textOriginal: Wish I had a sewing machine to do this. I’m going to try tomorrow and sew by hand!

snippet.textDisplay: I've tried a dozen mask patterns. This one seemed great, no pleats to sew over, but no matter what size i make it, it doesn't fit close to the face like yours. Thanks for the video though.
snippet.textOriginal: I've tried a dozen mask patterns. This one seemed great, no pleats to sew over, but no matter what size i make it, it doesn't fit close to the face like yours. Thanks for the video though.

snippet.textDisplay: Do take care.
snippet.textOriginal: Do take care.

snippet.textDisplay: What kind of filter goes in the pocket?
snippet.textOriginal: What kind of filter goes in the pocket?

snippet.textDisplay: You didn’t say how long to cut the wire for the face mask!
snippet.textOriginal: You didn’t say how long to cut the wire for the face mask!

snippet.textDisplay: This was great, we didn't make the pocket for the filter and just left the bottom open, turned it inside out, made the pocket for the wire with a garbage bag wire tie, and then used the clothes line recommended. THANKS for your time and sharing this with the world!!
snippet.textOriginal: This was great, we didn't make the pocket for the filter and just left the bottom open, turned it inside out, made the pocket for the wire with a garbage bag wire tie, and then used the clothes line recommended. THANKS for your time and sharing this with the world!!

snippet.textDisplay: Oh how nice for you to show this self-made pattern! Thank you so much! I am going to make some now for family and friends! Bless your heart! Stay healthy and safe!
snippet.textOriginal: Oh how nice for you to show this self-made pattern! Thank you so much! I am going to make some now for family and friends! Bless your heart! Stay healthy and safe!

snippet.textDisplay: Great design!  My only question is the filter pocket.  Is it really as big as the front side of the mask??  If so, my fear would be that my filter material could shift, but I guess I could just sew a large square in the center of the mask (line it up so the mouth is in the center of that square).  Or am I missing something and the filter pocket isn't that big?
snippet.textOriginal: Great design!  My only question is the filter pocket.  Is it really as big as the front side of the mask??  If so, my fear would be that my filter material could shift, but I guess I could just sew a large square in the center of the mask (line it up so the mouth is in the center of that square).  Or am I missing something and the filter pocket isn't that big?

snippet.textDisplay: Hi, Thanks for the pattern but I'm having a bit of a problem. I used the exact measurements you specified but my mask is open on sides and quite a way down on my neck. I tried to tighten it but the darn sides remail open. What on earth am I doing wrong? Lol...
snippet.textOriginal: Hi, Thanks for the pattern but I'm having a bit of a problem. I used the exact measurements you specified but my mask is open on sides and quite a way down on my neck. I tried to tighten it but the darn sides remail open. What on earth am I doing wrong? Lol...
